I was contacted by a parent today regarding a rumor that is circulating about how the district will respond to kids who become sick at school. Apparently, some people are saying that the schools will quarantine students without the parents knowledge of their location, or call the Health Department to pick up the child instead of the parent. This may be one of the craziest rumors I’ve ever heard. This is 100% FALSE. If a child becomes ill at school, we will call the parent to pick them up like we always have. Children will NEVER be released to anyone other than a parent, guardian or other emergency contacts provided by the parent. We will not be calling the health department to report that children became ill at school. We will not even offer an opinion about what illness your child may have. We are not doctors.
Please try not to fall victim to the crazy things that may be starting to spread. If you aren’t sure, please contact me. Thank you to the parent that contacted me with this one.
~ Jen Mast, Superintendent of Schools

Hopefully you have heard that the legislature released an initial plan for opening schools in the fall. This IS NOT the guidelines that we are waiting for from the Governor, but her plan is expected in one week.
I am happy to see lawmakers in Lansing actively working to advocate for much-needed school funding, and a commitment to a safe reopening in the fall. What the legislation introduced today is a good start, and we are hopeful for further discussions that aim to fully overcome the $3.3 billion deficit schools are facing. We also hope to see increased flexibility in standardized testing, reflecting the challenge and costs such testing would pose for schools as we try to get back to what really matters...educating our kids. More info to come in the near future.

Bob Brown, D7 Board Member, resigned from the Board of Education on January 22, 2020. The Board thanks Mr. Brown for his years of service and dedication to the District. According to law, the Board has 30 days to fill the vacancy.

Mandy Diroff, President
Dearborn Heights School District No. 7 Board of Education
20629 Annapolis
Dearborn Heights, MI 48125

Our hope is that this timeline allows interested parties plenty of time to consider applying for the vacancy. The Board will interview every candidate and make alternative arrangements for anyone unable to be interviewed on February 6, 2020.
We look forward to a great pool of candidates!
